*THUMP*

*THUMP*

After a few hits, there are a few mild movements on behalf of your captor’s hand as the finger is removed from above you and the lint is placed at her palm, leaving you exposed to the light and partially to the face of your captor, whom you have yet to identify from what you can see as she holds her hand closely to her face.

From your viewpoint, her most obvious feature is the all-seeing blue eye that stares judgmentally upon you with apparent difficulty, seeing as her eyelid jitters close as it tries to focus, making her eyelashes seem like black reeds shivering in the breeze, and the eye itself it’s starting to tear from the strain.

As for the other features, you’re too nervous to pay attention away from the eye, and at the same time you figure that this is your best chance to finally get some help! If you can make yourself more obvious to her, then you would get aid from mom and co; maybe not to return you to normal, but at least you would attain some safety. If only they knew…

With your free arm and a renewal feeling, you wave and yell to the curious ocular above while also moving the rest of your body in any way you can, expecting any and all sign of recognition in return.
The eye squints further in response to your movement, as if having difficulty in distinguishing your spasms. Your efforts were wasted it seems, as the eye soon pulls back and the lint holding you is moved away, which lets you see that Tina was the one holding you; which would explain your lack of acknowledgement on behalf of her near-sightedness. Unfortunately for you, that also means…

***


Sally wouldn’t deny Tina of any involvement in Cora’s prank; after all, she was the one who told them of her condescension, it was only right that Tina got to add the finishing touch, no matter if it was something so insignificant as a dusty little thread.

“Put it in, quick!”

Sally hushed to her friend, who was left wondering if she should put in the lint or just act inconspicuous while waiting for Cora to come in and try not to giggle as she drank the entire gunk they put into her drink. Tina assumed that Cora would be too busy also feigning innocence to notice at first that there was something afoul going on, and could already imagine the tantrum she would throw once she figured it out.

Swiftly, Tina inserted the lint into the glass, then just as quickly sat down on the couch and adopted the most inconspicuous look she could muster as she heard Sally opening the door and talking to Cora, whose conversation lasted for a while before both friends came back into the living room.

When they entered the living room, Tina noticed that Cora was no longer hiding a smirk, but instead was visibly upset, as her crossed arms and down-looking frown could tell. Surprised by this show of dismay, Tina wondered what had happened to put her in such a mood; question that the others were vocally asking.

“I don’t want to talk about it.” Cora responded coyly, her voice low in volume and a slight cringe in her tone. Evasively, she avoided eye contact with the other girls, and instead directed her look to the table, watching abstractly as she focused on her thoughts.

The others, safe for Sally, were perplexed by Cora’s recent change in her attitude. Had something awful had happened and the call she just received were just the bad news? That was the first question that nearly everyone was asking herself; followed by some with “Is she going to fall for it?”, with their curiosity only bested by their anticipation. Indeed, those that could barely hold their anticipation, despite their sympathy, or lack thereof, were about to offer her the tainted drink…

“I need a drink.” Cora exclaimed as she reached for one of the glasses laid out on a metallic tray on the table, causing some of the present to look down or distracted and feigning concern or plain indifference to avoid raising her awareness; which did not help nor obstruct them as Cora was too lost in her thoughts to even care about. But before she grabbed the glass, Sally interjected.

“Here, have this one, it’s the coldest.”

Sally spun the tray, putting another glass into Cora’s reach, and true to her word, it felt very icy in her grasp once Cora took it from the tray. She thanked her friend before taking a small sip of the glass, seemingly too concerned to follow with a quip. Sally meanwhile, took for herself the glass that Cora was first going to take, though she only held it in her hand as she watched Cora drink in angst.

An awkward silence followed, in the which most gazes switched back and forth between Cora, whose own stare was lost in her thoughts, and Sally, who was shifting her own between her worried friend and making eye signs to the others. The silence lasted until Tina finally spoke to change the subject, and others soon followed in her conversation, alleviating some of the present tension.

Everyone but Cora soon grabbed their own drinks as their talk went on, while Cora’s glass soon emptied and her look stood undisturbed over the course of the conversation. As the talk went on, all tension seemed to vanish once Sally and even Cora eventually joined in, if only for a short while as soon Cora asked Sally to accompany her back to her home to pick up a few things.

Sally accepted, and she and Cora excused themselves from the group, telling the others that they would be back soon as Cora’s apartment building was some blocks away; in the meanwhile, Tina suggested that the group could pass the time with a movie from Sally’s collection, which no one protested, and so Cora went to wait Sally at her car while she helped the staying friends to select from her movie collection.

Setting her still full glass on a small table beside the TV, Sally opened the door of a big wooden cabinet, revealing row after row of various movies that Sally had enjoyed over the years organized neatly in the cabinet shelves, which provoked a few amazed gasps from her friends. Once her friends had examined the collection and picked a film that everyone agreed on, Sally put it in her old player, which she still used with regularity, and after handing over the remotes for both the TV and the player to Emily, Sally excused herself out.

Before leaving, as she was halfway to the door, Sally heard someone calling her just behind, then a touch at her shoulder. She turned around; quick to attend her caller so Cora wouldn’t wait too long on her, to see…
1442112.title: Throw it in, delay Cora

choices: Swim through to avoid losing momentum.
14421121.content:
Sally turned to her back to find Tina, who happened to be concerned with her friends’ secrecy from before and wanted Sally to explain their shift in attitude; unlike others, Tina actually felt some remorse for Cora’s apparent lament and felt especially confused by Sally, usually Cora’s only real sympathizer, to follow on with the intended prank and give Cora the tainted glass with a snide grin on her face and then giggle quietly once she saw Cora drink down to the last drop; something she thought was unusually cruel of her friend.

“Sally, is something wrong? It’s not like you or Cora to act like that, what happened?” Tina asked in a tone that reflected equal parts of worry and curiosity as she knew that something that could flip her friends’ attitudes around had to be either severe or amazing.
In response, Sally just returned another smirk and a mild snicker, which Tina still found weird; and after a moment, she assured Tina:

“Oh, don’t worry about that dear, it’s nothing serious.” Sally paused for a moment to chill some more, “I just couldn’t help but to carry on with our little prank when I heard Cora whine about what she just had heard over the phone. I know it sounds bitchy of me, but when I tell you, you will love it too, see…” Sally paused once again, before drawing a breath to level her laugh and confess the gossip to Tina.

“Her landlord called, there was a flood in her building’s basement last night, a busted pipe or something, and pests are beginning to crawl in; she lives on the ground floor of the building. Go figure.”

Hearing this, Tina’s own expression turned from a concerned frown to an incredulous stare as she heard Sally explain, and true to her word, she found amusement in Sally’s words. Like teenagers hearing the latest gossip in high school, both Sally and Tina had a giggle fit that stemmed from their friend’s karmic backlash.

“Well anyway, she wants to pick up some things from home before vermin do, as well as a place to crash while they clean hers, so I guess I’ll be having a guest for some time now, oh well. We’ll be back quickly dear, but please, keep this talk between us.” Sally concluded, after which Tina made a zipping gesture on her lips with her fingers, then turned back to the hallway.

Having made Tina more of an accomplice in mischief than she was already, Sally left her to go return to accompany Cora while Tina left to get snacks for the movie, snickering the whole time up until she came back to the living room, where she kept her amusement down to keep secrecy; and so the pair left for Cora’s amenities.

***

Even though you could hear your mom, Beth and Tina talking, your focus in getting Tina’s attention distracted you from them, preventing you from actually listening to their talk in the case of mom and Beth; or in the case of Tina, understanding why she was talking about fleas.

Your lack of self-awareness notwithstanding, it still was no use, nothing short of a sign with your name pointing at you would get Tina’s watchful lazy-eye to notice you, and even if by chance you freed yourself from the lint, all you’d get for your troubles would be a long fall to your death from her hand. Realizing this, you stop struggling and instead wait until either she lays you down or stops moving, maybe then you could actually try and succeed without risking the fall.

For the next couple of seconds the sway of her movement carries your dirty dinghy on and the thrill serves to distract you from your helplessness, if only to replace it with a mixed feeling of fun and vertigo. The move is short however, and soon you feel her hand remove itself from below you and set free the dust bunny.

Though sudden, the drop barely fazed you, as by now you were getting used to sharp, sudden moves, and the drop didn’t felt as strong as it would, partly thanks to the cushion of the lint, instead it felt not unlike taking an elevator downstairs… while packed in a hobo’s bed.
As your grimy packing drafted below, the giant Tina above got farther from you, letting you appreciate her presence in a more complete manner, or at least her upper body, instead of just her monumental retina. Dressed in an open-buttoned, loose-fitting blue jacket with a more fitting black shirt beneath; her expression was the most telling aspect. With her eyes fixed on you, her lips formed a wicked smile that stretched her cheeks into a wide, teeth-showing grin. As your vessel lowered, clear glass walls rose from your peripheral vision, framing the sight of a now snickering Tina in a rising circling wall. (Full moon, Transylvanian background, thunder and crash not included.)

Did she actually know you were trapped in the ball of filth? Could it be that she could actually tell it was you, shrunk, struggling and trapped helpless in a minuscule-yet-bigger piece of filth, desperate to get her help? Was she mocking your predicament with her evil smile?

It certainly seemed like so, but why would she ignore your pleas and dismiss you so eagerly? Did she resent you for some reason?

Your doubts would remain unanswered as the descent came to an end soon after. The sinking feeling stopped, timely marked by a soft splash echoing below, and Tina turned her back and retreated beyond the clear walls, leaving you alone again bound in dusty ropes, now circled by a tall glass pen and surrounded by the women’s whispering voices.

As Tina left, you contemplated the enclosure she casually dropped your grimy craft into, as much as your entrapped self could observe from atop the bed of dust. The glass walls created a wide, circular enclosure around you stained by the blurry, moving image of the world outside the walls. Beyond that you couldn’t tell much about your holding pen, other than there had to be some liquid below, as you could hear sloshing water beneath the threads and still feel a slight sway carrying your lint, despite no longer being in Tina’s grasp.

With nothing else of note about your surroundings you retry your efforts at freedom, this time in a more relaxed, focused manner, thanks to the soothing sway and not being under the stress of being stepped on the floor or desperate for bitchy Tina’s help anymore.

Soon after, not thrashing like a maniac pays off when you manage to pull and yield at the right threads holding you, instead of yanking all of them at once and hoping for the best. With a steady, controlled grip you untangle your legs and torso from the loosened threads, freeing yourself from the oppressive lint at last…

Still, you now found yourself trapped behind a high wall of glass of unknown purpose, as you couldn’t figure out where Tina had dropped you. If it weren’t for the liquid below, you would think it was an ash tray, though you think the walls were still too high for that; and the present smell, though obfuscated by the ever present cloud of dust in the lint, certainly wasn’t that of spent tobacco, but rather cheap booze and cleaning products. Maybe they spilled some beer in it then cleaned it lazily and left water on it?

Though curious for the nature of your glass enclosure, your lungs yearned even more for a breath of air clear of dust. Carefully, you maneuver over the threads and folds of the lint without tangling yourself again, though your movement conjures up more puffs of dust clouds that coats and put you in a coughing fit that lasts until you reach a point where the threads and filth aren’t dense enough to traverse, resulting in you falling through them.

The blunder of your slip cost your balance, and even though you didn’t get caught in the threads this time, the resulting fall didn’t last either. You assumed that you would hit a glass bottom when you fell through and maybe get laced with ash or wet with the puddle of water that the lint landed on. What you didn’t expect however, was diving right through the surface of the assumed puddle and sinking into a pool that was deep enough to let you through without even touching the bottom. Luckily you had your eyes shut before hitting the water, thanks to the constant pestering of the dust clouds.

After getting over the surprise of the unexpected dive, you kick into swimming upwards, expecting to surface immediately. Instead, a sudden jolt spurs the waters into chaos just as you break your swim, submerging you again and in turn making you taste the water instead of air, or as you had accurately thought earlier, cheap booze mixed with dish soap.

The waves are short lived, as you break the surface after just a moment and start spitting out the nasty brew and clearing your eyes from it, as even closed shut they burned from the abrasive substance. When you opened them, the first thing you noticed was that the lint had been moved slightly; now a floating puff on the pool you were in.

Next, there was the familiar feeling of being lifted, accompanied by waves crashing mildly around in the pool. Above the tall glass wall, towering over in the same way Tina had a minute ago, Cora appeared; her large face upset in a frown as it neared towards your swimming pond.

It didn’t take you another second to figure out the true nature of your surroundings, for Cora didn’t smoke but loved herself some alcohol, and no trace of dust, soap, wayward swimmers, or cheapness of quality in her drink was going to stop her from enjoying her nectar of choice.

As if your cord had been sprung into overdrive, you break into a frantic swim in Cora’s opposite direction. It just so happened that your former filthy vessel was that way, and the shifting tide arranged you both in a crash course. Cora's sailor-proud mouth approached with a sea-worthy thirst, and with only seconds to react you…
14421121.title: Healthy concern

choices: Move away from her tongue and try to reach her gums. Play it safe.
Pretty much the same, but try to cross her teeth this time. Can't go wrong.
144211211.content:
Without a second thought or moment to spare, you dive under the changing tide and keep swimming still against the forming current. At the cost of your previous speed and tears in your eyes (totally from the spoiled beer and not at all from the fear of meeting Cora’s breakfast), you manage to delve deep under the surface and from there keep swimming without bothering to keep a pace to your strokes.

It only lasts a few seconds, but the flow becomes strong enough to carry you a long way back even with your frantic swimming. Faster and faster you keep your unsynchronized strokes, yet against the frothy current you flop to stand against as it pulls you even faster, like a fish fleeing from a whale. Not that you would ever call Cora something remotely similar to a whale, even when at your size she could fit one in her mouth whole, for the fear that she would show you what a whale could do to an itty bitty fish such as yourself; which was likely what was going to happen now, if the flow of botched beer didn’t stop soon.

As if by chance, the overwhelming strength of the current dies down, as you could tell by the sudden outburst of speed that you experienced while keeping your own flop of a pace going on.

Relieved (though not overly so, as the lack of warmth in your pants could tell) you surface from the dust-drugged drink to a lake of bubbling, off-colored mead and the great glass walls from before now even taller in their height, and your escape seems just as unlikely as it was before, sans the binding of the lint’s threads. One step to the side, two steps back.

Replacing Tina as the titan overseeing your entrapment is Cora still, with a facial expression you had never witnessed in her before, or even considered her capable of: melancholic indifference. At least it looks like so, if her worrisome frown is any sign of her distress. Or more likely, she just tasted the botched excuse for a cocktail you took part of an olive in and just winced at its unpleasantness.

Surely if that’s the case, then the next step in your little puny (Ha! Double pun!) odyssey involves a trip to the kitchen sink as she pours the tainted glass over into the drain and gets herself another drink. Hopefully if you and your mom slacked on the dishes then you could avoid falling directly into the drain and drowning in there; it still wouldn’t be easy to get somewhere even remotely safe from a huge, uncaring world, but so far nothing has been.

And so you wait for Cora to get up and spill her glass into the kitchen sink any moment now, maybe as soon as she tells what’s up with the overly bitter, dirty-sockey aftertaste of her drink. Yup, any second now, she’s sure to spit the taste out and yell at someone for their awful barista skills.
Any second now…

…

Well, she definitively is taking her sweet time to release you from your bitter imprisonment. Her stare is still fixed just above you not looking either at you or her friends, and their ongoing overall silence is just as unnerving as her lack of action.

But that ends once she inexplicably nears her lips to the glass once more, as if she didn’t get the awful taste down the first time; and while wondering her no doubt burned-out sense of taste you break out into strokes away from her incoming kisser.

Without anything else but the antagonizing current to slow you down, keeping away from Cora’s thirst isn’t as troublesome as the first time, but remains just as terrifying; after all, wouldn’t even take a mistake on your part, if she decides to drink in a stronger pace at any moment, it becomes very likely that you’ll spend the rest of your afternoon (and likely your life) practicing your freestyle swim in her gut.

For the next longest-drawn minutes, you keep this small routine with Cora, each time your fear zigzags between heightening and plummeting. She drinks, you bolt, she stops, you stop, repeat ad nauseam. As the water level recedes, you get used more and more to the smell of dish-soap spiked beer and Cora’s breath, as well as the taste of the former, to the point where it doesn’t even bother you anymore. However, at the same time concern for your escape starts to outweigh your current fears, considering that even if you outlast Cora’s disheartened thirst there’s no way that the glass can be climbed out of, barring some lucky happening.

As your routine comes and goes little else happens, a conversation starts outside of your enclosure, livening up the otherwise silent (not counting the slosh you’re in of course) ambient. As it develops, Cora too brings her face up from her mile stare and joins the chatter, her voice not unlike what you would hear were you just under the speaker of a music concert, and between the talk and her sipping you find more time to take short rests from swimming.

A short while later there’s not much drink left in the glass at all as you can see the bottom of the glass now, the wooden texture of the table barely visible just below in all its scratched glory. So far it seems like you will outlast Cora’s thirst for now, as long as she doesn’t feel like having a refill you’ll have a more peaceful time getting out of the glass and try another way to get someone to notice you already, without any further incidents you hope.

For about fifty seconds you wait impatiently for Cora to finish her drink already, without also downing you of course, no matter how close you had been with her lips in the last few minutes, you had no intention of going any further than a kiss with her. While you follow that train of thought, the moment of truth approaches.

The glass lifts one more time as the booze tide tilts to its side and the impossibly tall crystal wall ramps up into the opening of Cora’s widening lips, just as you had become used to in your captivity. As usual, you begin your strokes in the opposite direction and wait excitedly for some rest at least, confident that after this last sip quenches her thirst you will get some time off before you have to worry about getting out again.

Left stroke…

Right stroke…

Paddling…

Tirelessly you return to your swimming feats and back to the glass, and sure enough its clear bottom beholds a panel where you can clearly (sort of) see the other women present at mom’s social gathering, but the one that draws your attention most now is Tina. Deep down you know the idea that she placed you deliberately in Cora’s spoiled drink for no discernible reason is outlandish in itself, but again, so is your shrinkage; who knows, maybe it was her who put you in Lilliput shoes to begin with, seems about right if you believe her to be aware of your situation.

Back to your current problem, you then welcome back the tilting of the glass increases as Cora empties it entirely. The last of the foul brew washes from the glass into her ever thirsty throat, and as it leaves vacuum in the glass you find yourself hitting the floor as your strokes stop matching the depths. Rapidly you try to stand on the glass, but quickly find out that it’s too smooth and slippery to get a sure footing.

Uh oh… this is something you didn’t anticipate. Left with no way to resist and with a very warm feeling upon your back you feel fear to start taking over you again. Swiftly you turn on your back as the rapids wash you down to see where they have you headed: a dark, flooding pit bordered by the glass and Cora’s plump lips, where the river of booze was swallowed behind her spit-shiny tongue and became part of an even fouler brew in her gut.

The sight of your destination motivated you further to keep up the effort, futile as it was. One misstep and a slip later you’re tumbling down the glass towards Cora’s still awaiting mouth, hitting first on her soft tongue which then sucks you in with the last of the drink as the sound of her swallowing echoed off in the cup.

Everything goes dark as Cora’s inebriated tongue rolls you to the back of her mouth, where you expect with dread to follow the way of many a bar snack peanut to her stomach. But instead you feel relief when her tongue rolls you no more, stopping you from further approaching her throat.

For the following minute, you try to get your bearings on her spongy appendage, finding it even more slippery and unstable than the glass was, and just as unlikely to get away from. Trying to even stand up takes up more effort than it should, partly because her happy-hour hardened taste buds make for a poor grip, and partly because you don’t spend at least ten minutes swimming in beer and not get tipsy in the process; and staying up becomes a bigger challenge as her tongue shifts beneath your feet, making you wonder if she can taste or even feel you at all.

Doubtfully so, and you will certainly remain undetected if and when Cora’s thirst has an encore with you still in her mouth, or whatever gets you first. As of now, you abandon your sink escape plans and start formulating a new one, or at least what your slightly buzzed mind can pass as a plan.

Blinded and uneasy by the dark, moist, smelly surroundings, you quickly settle for the first thing that sounds remotely safe, and decide to reason a better course once you’re out of immediate danger. As such, you…
144211211.title: React!Dive

choices: Yes, you have to wait for a better chance to move.
Silence, time to make a break for it?
1442112111.content:
You tried to make your way off of Cora's tongue before she swallowed you but she was not making it easy. The wobbling of the muscle was exacerbated by the random movements of her head and body as she listened to her friends converse. As you fell back and forth onto the soft floor the coating of beer that had clung to you was licked off and replaced with her spit. It felt gross to keep rubbing against the weathered, undulating, slimy taste buds. That combined with your inebriation and the inescapable smell of bad breath made for a truly nauseating ordeal. Speaking of stomach-turning, a groan from Cora's stomach rumbled from below, reminding you of the danger you were in. It had been minutes since you had been dumped past Cora's lips which meant that another drink would likely be joining you any second. As much as you didn't like being inside the mouth of your mom's friend, the idea of being washed down to her stomach was far from an acceptable solution. You picked yourself up again and immediately felt on your ass. You hit the spongy flesh with such force that you bounced up into the air before landing with a face plant. It gave you an idea. You wiped your face off and managed to balance yourself long enough to jump up. Upon coming down onto the tongue, the elastic flesh squished underneath your miniscule weight and launched you back into the air. You sprang around on Cora's tongue like you were in a wiggling bouncy castle. Not only was it kind of fun, but it was working. After numerous bounces you made it to the edge of the tongue. Now you were face to face with a wall of off-white teeth. All 32 of them were as big as a house to you and could easily crush you without her even trying. You spied a small gap down on the gums between the two teeth closest to you, a suitable shelter for the time being.

You begin trying to position yourself so you can slide right in but you were interrupted by Cora. Having finished trying to think about what could have been wrong with her drink, she was joining in with her friend's conversation. As she moved her massive tongue to form the sound of words, you were dealing with a magnitude 12.8 earthquake. Her lips opened up letting in the familiar light of your home. A deafening roar echoed around you as she voiced her opinion on something. Fortunately her saliva was keeping you put where you were. You didn't want to have all of your progress undone or end up on top of her teeth. After a few disorienting seconds, Cora retuned her tongue to its resting position and you quickly pulled yourself from the muscle. You tumbled down the smooth edge of the appendage and landed on the side of her gums. Your scramble up the firm flesh hunker down where she would floss. While there was no noticeable food present, the surface of the teeth down here was more yellowed and stained than you expected.

You braced yourself as best as you could while covering your ears as Cora engaged in conversations with the girls. You might be safer now but you were not completely safe from being converted into food. Her booming voice was head splitting from your proximity and you feared you might suffer some long term damage. It wasn't too long before Cora grabbed your mother to run back to her place to grab something, not that you knew what was going on outside of Cora's body. They hopped into your mother's car and started heading for Cora's place. Do they talk on the drive over?
1442112111.title: Getting to the Gums

choices: She heads back to the car.
She downs a quick drink before she leaves.
14421121111.content:
Cora sighs as she lets her head sink into the headrest of the passenger seat. "Thanks a lot for doing this Sally. I'll try to be fast so we can get back to the party."

"Don't worry about it," Mom replies. "You've had a hell of a week and now this flood thing..."

"Ugh," Cora groans, "I am so sick of our 'Great Leader' some times I wish I could just... Ugh."

"Yeah, he really laid into you yesterday," Mom comments.

"What is it with short guys anyway?" Cora asks. "I wish he was a little shorter, then I could squish him like the vermin he is." She smiles as she imagines crushing the source of her workplace annoyance.

"Well he's got the whiskers of a rodent alright," Mom jokes. She gets a hard laugh out of Cora and smiles a bit herself. She was glad that her friend was warming up a bit.

"I just hope that my room isn't full of water," Cora says letting out another sigh. "It's time like this I'm glad I've got insurance but if my deadbeat landlord did his job things like this might not happen."

"He's one of those, what do you call it, slumlords?" Mom asks after finding the word she was looking for.

"Pretty much," Cora nods. "It's cheap and a good location for me but the guy in charge is a bum. If something goes wrong it's a fight to even get ahold of him. Then if you don't have the rent to him before the due date he pops up just to ride your ass. Hell this one time the rent came due on a long holiday weekend so it got tied up in the mail system."

"I take it he was less than understanding," Mom interjects.

"He came into my place with his keys and practically jumped down my throat," Cora exclaimed. "I told him it was in the mail and even showed him my checkbook when he wouldn't stop bitching. I swear sometimes men just piss me off."

"Oh I know you don't mean that. They're not all bad, like my little Adam," Mom muses.

"Yeah I guess he's a sweet kid," Cora relents. "Just keep him away from me tonight, I'm likely to kill the next man I come into contact with. Ladies night girl!"

----------

Roaring words echoed around the fleshy chamber as you hunkered down in between Cora's colossal chompers. You could only cover your ears and try to remain conscious as your splitting migraine grew worse with every sentence Cora spoke. The flapping of her jaw made you feel like you were glued to a bucking bronco and while the sticky saliva was keeping you safe from digestion, the ride was not a relaxing one. Light randomly flashed in from her beyond the lips and reflected off the numerous glistening surfaces making it difficult to see, not that seeing was something that you really wanted to do. The unbrushed mouth of a heavy drinker was far from an image of beauty and every time the light shined in long enough to look around you spied another piece of meat, bread, or lettuce that was stuck firm to a tooth, each bit bigger than you. The only positive thing about Cora talking is that the circulating air is keeping the pungent odor from becoming staler. Trying to escape now would be suicide. If you didn't get battered to death by her crocked teeth and oozing tongue, you'd likely be swallowed along with her excess saliva. As agonizing as it was, you had to wait. Trapped like a scrap of food, soaking in drool and buffeted by deafening gossip.

-----------


Your mother made really good time getting to Cora's place.

"I'll try to be quick," Cora says as she steps out of your family car, "just gotta grab some essentials for the sleep-over and rat-proof a few things."

"You need a hand?" Your mother calls out as Cora bolts for the entrance.

"Thanks but I got it," Cora replies. She pulls out her keys and returns to the little hole in the wall she calls home. Everything seemed to be as she had left it. You couldn't call it clean, but there was no sign of pest encroachment. Eager to get back to the party before losing her buzz, she began grabbing what she needed and threw it into a duffle bag. She sealed things she wanted to make sure were safe in bins and locked any loose jewelry in her safe. After about 15 minutes, she was satisfied with her work and turned for the door. Before she took another step though, a small burp popped up from her belly, tasting of the skunky drink she had back at the party. She grimaced at the unpleasantness and made a b-line for her fridge. Pulling a nearly full 24 pack from the chilly closet, she figured that it was up to her to make sure that there was some decent beer for them to have.
14421121111.title: Chit Chat

choices: Nevermind, down the whiskey hatch you go!
14421121112.content:
While lying hidden down beneath your ivory-and-flesh shelter, you experience little to no disturbance coming from Cora, giving you some time to rest from the Jaws extra / circus acrobat act, for the moment at least. Saliva pools around you, only to drain below her teeth, and at the same time you can see the tip of her tongue rising to her palate. The echo of her throat gulping down the excess drool makes you shiver for a moment as you realize that a few seconds and lucky bounces marked all the difference in the pH of the liquid currently bathing you. The rot of her breath soon became lost to your still inebriated mind, and so was the damp warmth of her mouth to your already-soaked skin; and while the escapade on her tongue had been bumpy, to say the least, the soft, pad-like bed of her gums has left you with an odd feeling of peace… and mild desolation.

Surely Cora should have noticed your movements along her grime-caked teeth by now, if not while tossing you on her whiskey-washed tongue; and thus you would expect her to begin prodding at your location with a toothpick, a nail, her tongue even. She has to notice you sometime… right?

Well, she does prod at your vicinity with her tongue several times, each time the wet, spongy appendage scrapes by at you with great force; sometimes overshooting your position, others just barely pushing you against her gums, and whenever it’s not doing either it just lays resting against you, hugging your mite-self in between soft muscle and slightly-less soft muscle, with a lucky gap between both for you to breathe. For a moment you worry that she will pull you out of your enamel-lacking safe spot and without even bothering will either spit or swallow you to your doom, or pull you out and discard you without acknowledging your identity, much like Tina (hopefully) did.

And yet, your whereabouts remain unknown to the giant still, her tongue just scrubs lazily on her opal-ey yellows. If being unnoticed by everyone outside, right under their noses (once even literally) was crushingly lonesome and null of your existence; being unnoticed while right inside the mouth of your mother’s giant coworker had to be another harsh blow to your psyche.

Or would be, if a) your BAC wasn’t on par with a frat-boy freshman’s; and b) you didn’t have more serious problems to worry about at the moment, like how you are going to tie your shoes now that you fit neatly into the plastic tip of the laces, or how are you going to exit from Cora’s person altogether (hopefully by wearing size one fit-all… everything; and the way you came in and in one piece, in that order).

But it’s not the lack of presence that unnerves you, that’s something you’ve got used to by now; nor was it the many misadventures that you had endured up until now, on the verge of being devoured by your mother’s ill-mannered, alcoholic friend, as your very own inebriation was starting to fog out your fears and buff up your nerve in a spell of whiskey courage.

It’s the general silence that’s starting to get you.

Right now her voice should be giving you the worst headache ever, and that’s without waiting for a hangover to hammer in; and yet, only the drip of her drool and the lull of her breathe is present to keep you company, with the occasional intrusion of her roaring hunger echoing by to remind you one of the many dangers of your station.

From your makeshift shelter you can barely hear the world above and beyond the barrier of her lips that your mom was making some conversation. Something about work, if you understand correctly, which most likely you don’t; yet that makes stranger still that Cora would remain silent at all, even at moments when Sally seems to draw a brief pause in her speech for her.

Other than that, the noise of heavy traffic, screeching halts, endless honking and rushing wind are the most evident sounds that give off where your hosts are traveling right now. Maybe Cora passed out and mom’s driving her home. Such a good friend… That would explain her shutting up for once, but shouldn’t she be snoring now?

Mysteries of the world aside, your stay in Cora’s uncannily silent, cavity troubled… cavity, is less than eventful for as long as the motor outside keeps running; which you then take as a signal to make your leave. Cora remains silent still, the lashing of her tongue has all but stopped now, this time without trapping you; and Sally keeps going her talk on the phone, which at least gives you a voice to eavesdrop on to keep you entertained, even if you couldn’t make a word out of it. But even then, you can’t help but wonder what’s going on outside…

***

Fortunately for both Sally and Cora, Sally had barely any alcohol intake at all before leaving, so her sobriety at the wheel was granted. However, that was more than could be said for any other safety measures taken behind the wheel, as the voice talking over the phone on her shoulder could attest.

“Yes Nelly, the new applicants will be arriving next week, don’t worry about…-”

Cora, never to be impolite to other people talking on the phone (the rest of her manners, or lack thereof, notwithstanding), remained silent for as long as her friend chatted over to their coworker, discussing matters that were best left to them. During the trip back home, she felt a light tickle fickle on her licker, a picky sensation much like the one she would feel by drinking the chill frothing from a soda that was poured too fast. Strangely, the feeling was as short lived as it was sudden, but she thought no more of it after the fact, and instead preoccupied herself to think about the things she was going to bring back from the trip.

The ride back to Cora’s apartment came down to a slow crawl for Cora and Sally soon after leaving the gathering hostess’ home block when, once they turned for downtown at an intersection, they were met with the longest, most sluggish traffic lane that could be found outside a turnpike pile-up.

“Ugh… You wouldn’t believe this Nelly; it’s like a parade to get free stuff at Macy’s. I can’t even move an inch without parking again!

…Yes, she’s with me. No, she ain’t much happier about it, how could you tell?

…You’re terrible, you know that?”

Just when she thought that a good day couldn’t be ruined any more, here comes this traffic of apocalyptic proportions to prevent Cora from getting home in time to safeguard her valuables. There was no telling if she would find crawlies all over her jewel cases, or if she’ll be able to spray her kitchen cabinets before they can get in, or heavens forbid, if she finds a fried rat that thought her computer’s power cord would make for a good gnaw-toy; and wasting at least half an hour (at best) wasn’t helping matters.

She could feel it in her guts, this day was about to get worse.

***

Well, after so much waiting, you’re set to take Cora’s likely ethylic pass-out as the window of chance for your exit. If you’re lucky, you’ll be able to slip through the gap of her lips without much trouble. Of course, if you were lucky, you wouldn’t be playing extreme tonsil-jockey with her in the first place.

In spite of your (largely hops-fueled) optimism and plans, you come up with the first block in the road out of Cora’s mouth when you try to pass through the gap of her incisors. As it turns out, even when you are no larger than a fleck of dirt, you’re still too big to squeeze through, much to your dismay; you’ll have to look around in her mouth for a gap big enough for you to cross. So, with some tricky maneuvering, you set yourself loose from the tight space between her bottom incisors and begin your trek along her gums to find that opening.

On the squishy, slippery flesh you stumble about in the darkness, threading in her drool and the soggy gunk of many an unflavored snack to the sound of dripping, drowsy breathing, and heavy traffic; with just barely any footing to avoid slipping below the colossal tongue. Were your mom’s friend the kind of person that rests her head against the seat you could risk slipping and falling down below her tonic-tested taster, leaving you trapped to drown in her pooling saliva. Luckily for you (and unfortunately for her neck, you guess), her bowed head means you get a semi-straight path for your clumsy steps. But then… the unthinkable happens…

The muscle awakens!

It seems that the giant woman isn’t as much of a deep sleeper as you thought!

Your leisurely trekking goes unnoticed no longer as Cora sweeps all along her bottom row of teeth with her tongue, picking you up on the tip in the process. A deep, roaring yawn escapes from her depths as the gates of her lips open, bringing light to the pandemonium you’re swept in at the moment. In the brief moment that her tongue returns to a neutral position and you’re perched on the tip, you see the panoramic view outside shift to the side, from the trunk of a van to your gargantuan mother looking at you and snapping her fingers in front of Cora’s face. A split second later, as the tongue begins lifting, you turn around to see a rugged, wet pink slide rising for you, flanked by rows of stained marble and leading straight into a dark pulsing hole guarded by a single reddish upside-down buoy. It is then that a single thought comes to pierce the clouds of booze in your mind and sobers you up, even if it’s for that very moment:

OH, SH*T!

You wouldn’t ever have hoped to make this question, less so if you ever wanted to keep both of your eyes, but now your very fate depends on it. Does Cora spit or swallow?
14421121112.title: Silence, off the cans

144211211121.content:
Cora lived a short distance from Sally's home and the surprisingly heavy traffic was bringing the trip down to a crawl. Unable to engage her companion in conversation as she was on her phone, Cora zoned out to the sound of the world around her. She mindlessly twiddled her fingers, cracking her neck, scrubbing her tongue against her teeth... "What's this?" Cora thought as her tongue brushed against something unusual. There was some kind of tiny, hardish bit in her mouth that wasn't there before. What's more it tasted oddly familiar. She scooped it up with the tip of her tongue as she tried to figure out what it was.

Cora was snapped out of her trance by the snapping of her friend's fingers. "Cora quick, can I take this side road and loop around to your place?" Sally asked with a touch of urgency.

Cora yawned as her eyes scanned the area Sally was pointing. Cora quickly recognized the street as one she had used before as a detour for commuting to work. "Yeah go go," Cora replies through her yawn. As Sally jerks the wheel to quickly turn off, the inertia causes all of Cora's drool to drain to her throat. Tired of tasting this poorly flavored bit on her tip, she gets ready to swallow it down to, stopping as she suddenly places the taste. Opening up again, she reaches in and plucks the mystery ingredient. She brought it up to her eye to inspect it...

-----------

You clutched the wet taste-buds has hard as you could as runny saliva streamed around and over you towards the previously dark throat. With the light of the street shining in, every detail was no longer limited to your imagination. A stew of food scraps and frothy spit was pooling back there, eagerly awaiting its passage to the stomach. The lips came back down, trapping you once again in darkness. As the tongue arches, your tenuous hold fails and you begin sliding back to certain death. You begin screaming before coming to a sudden stop as the tongue suddenly lurches upwards, pressing you into the palate. Light pierces the boozy fog, something you thought you'd never see again. When a pair of fingers enter the maw, your heart soared. Less than gingerly, she grabs you and pulls you out. A strand of spit trails from you back to the tongue, as if it doesn't want you to go. You however couldn't be more thrilled to be free from the heinous quagmire of Cora's mouth. The cool air of the car's A/C felt wondrous, though your clothes would forever smell of Cora's unique brand of halitosis. The fingers crushing your ribs stopped in front of an eye the size of a movie screen. Though beaten and tired, you waved and called to get Cora's attention...

-----------

Cora glared at the foul thing she pulled from her tongue. "I knew it," She exclaims.

"What's that?" Sally asks.

"The glass you gave me, it was dirty. I just pulled this speck of dirt from my glass out of my teeth." Cora thrusts her fingers next to Sally's head.

"Eww, Cora get that out of my face. I'm trying to drive. I don't want to see anything that's been in your mouth," Sally says disgusted.

"Well don't give you friends filthy glasses. Tasted like soap and floor," Cora growls as she retracts her hand.

"You could have gotten another glass. Didn't think I had to tell YOU to help yourself to a drink," Sally laughs.

"Ha ha, I figured you just got some cheap, vile swill. Wanted to gauge how the night was going to go before I forced more of it down," Cora moans.

"Oh poor you. There might still be some trace alcohol on that dirt, you could eat it. Sally teases.

"I'm not THAT desperate, though I'm pretty close," Cora growls.

"Just don't wipe it off on the car please," Sally sighs.

Since she did say please, Cora decided not to wipe the crud on the side of the seat. Instead she settled on...
144211211121.title: Freedom!

144211211122.content:
A little but well-known fact about Cora, her lest liveliest organ is her liver.

Another, more relevant fact about Cora, she only does spit takes when somebody makes a funny comment while watching cheesy movies a la MST3K.

Whilst sober and in her glass of screwed-up screwdriver you feared that this moment would come, that you would be caught like a wayward fish sucked into a hungry whale’s mouth, with nowhere to swim to – nowhere to escape from your impending doom in the gut of this gargantuan monster. A monster of greater size, coarse mouth, exquisite tastes, and bottomless belly; and you get to experience all of them in front-row.

Being tipsy and dizzy doesn’t change much that train of thought, but it makes it much harder to focus on. But then again, perhaps that’s for the best.

As your mother’s fingers snap in front of your ivory cage, a rush of wind rivaling that of a hurricane blows past into Cora’s mouth. The bold influx of wind caused by her yawn is both parts welcome breeze of fresh air to remember there exists wind that doesn’t stink of stale hops and morning breath, and fearsome flurry to nearly yank you from your perch at the tip of her tongue and sucking you all the way back to her throat. You barely manage to hold your breath on the tongue until she stops yawning, if only because she stopped shortly after your mom snapped at her; leaving you to face the next hurdle without the blinding light of the outside to raise your hopes.

Streams of clear, thick liquid reeking of Cora’s fermented breath pour down the great flopping pink beast that you are currently struggling to remain on top of, flowing lightly at first then gushing rapidly down the slope as the muscle rose against her palate. Gallons upon gallons drain down the lumpy surface and into the dark, flexing chute at the back; carrying many uneaten bits of food that her tongue just scraped from her teeth: soggy bread crumbs, salty chip crumbs, dip-caked celery, some bits of chicken meat that seem to have endured her feasting until they rotted in her gums (huh, that sounds familiar…); and various other meat bits, yet excluding the one that was putting any meaningful resistance against her ravenous oral self-cleaning.

*Gluck*

That is, a rogue bit of processed turkey meat that was still stuck between her molars. Everything else in her mouth was about to ride the Swallow Express all the way down to downtown Digestown, where the bourbon flows and problems melt away. All aboard now!

*Gluck*

You, on the other hand, can barely hold your grip on the tip of her tongue before the risen height of her tongue betrays your efforts. The more her licker lifts up, the more your hands slip from the spongy muscle, until it reaches halfway up and you cannot hold any longer. In great grief your hands release from the wet summit, and immediately after you slip and slide down the grove running down the middle of her tongue. You are lapped all the way down to the bottom as your body drags face down on the slightly rugged surface, turning around halfway down so your back takes the punishment instead, soaking damp your whole body thoroughly in her saliva in the process; and you wonder for a moment if she can taste your being.

It is not long before you are met with a pond of saliva sitting at the back just before the great chasm of her throat, along with the other bits of fished-up gunk now littering the pool, casually draining below the likewise slimy pendulum swinging slightly above. That is, the flow drips relatively quietly into the hole, until the tongue lurches beneath you and pushes everything forward as the flesh of her throat flexes the entrance open once again, and the resulting surge drags everything and everyone towards the drop in one swift, powerful, world-consuming motion.

*GULP*

And down you keep sliding! Off her tongue you go, sliding into the more cramped precipice that is the gullet of mom’s most hawkish cougar of a friend. Your down-on-the-digits size means that your descent is a tumble-filled affair – the contraction of Cora’s throat muscles has little effect on gripping you when your height is barely on the scales; and so you slide down one side of the squishy wall, only to be tilted to the other once a rippling wave that is intended to push food down pushes you forward instead. Nevertheless, its purpose is accomplished still, as the tiny amount of loose food still finds its way to the chamber of her digestion to fuel her daily shenanigans.

This is about the moment that you would realize that, despite your best efforts, you were about to become part of Cora’s lunch. In a few seconds, you will have the same relevance in the world as a hot-wing, with just a fraction of the calories to say that at least you got her fat. That entire odyssey to get noticed and helped by mom or her friends was about to end as a bowel movement, and the only one who presumably knew of your ordeal was the one that subjected you to it.

Such a cruel fate would be the subject of your laments, had you a straight head for them to hammer in. But all you can actually think of at the moment is…

*SQUELCH*

Won’t…

*THUMP*

that…

*SQUELCH*

noise…

*THUMP*

FUCKING…

*SQUELCH*

STOP?!

*GURGLE*

All that biological chaos serves only to pound your head into mushy pulp, more painfully so than the gastric pool waiting for you at the bottom of this flume would. You scream out, not out of fear or for Cora’s attention, but rather in hopes that your own cries would drown out all other sound. After being subjected to this torment, the unsettling silence of her mouth becomes a welcome commodity that you long for, a feeling no doubt shared by the most impatient amongst her coworkers.

Then, before your head could explode in screeching agony, you reached the bottom of the slick flesh chute, where the load of gunk and you were released into a wider space – an equally fleshy, slightly more putrid, much slimier sack.

***

After a merciful opening in the transit presented itself, Sally took a turn out of the Sluggish Lane of Woe and from there she took a detour to Cora’s apartment building. Out of the half eternity the friends thought they would spend in traffic, they only made an extra five minutes or so until they reached the six-story condo.

Upon entering the building and on the way to Cora’s apartment, both visitors were met by a plenty of puddles littering through the first floor, along with many doors with various cloths fixed underneath to prevent the water from leaking into the apartments – towels, old rags, even worn-out clothing articles were soaking up on the floor; some of them performing poorly at that, as the dark, moist stains forming at the bottom of their wooden slabs could tell. But as far as pests counted for, only a couple of mice were present, lapping up some liquid from the shallow pools.

Incidentally, that was a couple of mice more than Cora was willing to tolerate near her home.

She didn’t even wait for Sally to catch up with her step; once she saw the tiny rodents she made a mad dash towards her digs, uncaring if she wetted her carpet by running over some puddles along the way, or staining it in the blood of a mouse that she nearly stepped on when it blindly crossed her path while escaping from the stomping giantess on the loose.

Once the worried resident reached her door, she practically knocked it down to get inside, seemingly wanting to break the hinges, the knob and the key with sheer force. But her spirits-boosted spirit calmed down when she peeked into her apartment and, at first glance, saw no signs of pests inside.

“Phew…” The sight of her untouched possessions filled her breathe with relief. However, she knew that it would only be a matter of time, and so she began to work on safeguarding what she couldn’t take back to Sally’s house.

When her friend caught up, Cora was already done packing up clothes for at least a week, and had already started to pack her electronics’ cables and jewel cases, both jewelry and music CDs, in plastic bags before stuffing them in a box. She wasn’t much more receptive of the state of disrepair just outside, and wasn’t shy to voice her opinion; not that it was something Cora would disagree with anyway.

“What a mess, how can that slumlord of yours keep a place like this?”

“By being a greasy sleaze with tight pockets and no idea how to manage a playground. I’m just glad that there ain’t rats in my pants for now.” Cora responded in upset rant as she wrapped up a bag full of silver jewelry.

“…Wouldn’t be the first time.” Sally whispered under her breath.

“What was that?”

“I said: let me help you with that.”

Taking a bag and a handful of cases herself, Sally began helping her friend with her packing. Before long all of Cora’s valuables were neatly tucked away in the large trunk, which in turn was stashed away in a closet.

“Thanks Sal, you’re a real pal. Now let me just spray and lock down the place; then we can go back and watch Tina become a ninja, or whatever she was talking about.”

Happy that her home was now safeguarded, Cora and Sally both left to return to Sally’s house, taking the same time-saving detour on the way back. On the way back they had time to chat better now that both of them were in a good mood, and shared some humor comparing Cora’s landlord to their boss, then in turn comparing them both to unwanted vermin.

It was not long before they arrived back to Sally’s house, when Cora began to feel a small cramp in her lower abdomen…
144211211122.title: In the lieu of the tenant

1442112111221.content:
Having reached the dank depths of Cora’s digestive tract, you and the rest of the food bits are treated to a short fall through nearly non-existent ethylic air and a soft landing, breaking into the waves of a shallow lake of sloppy, thick waters.

*SPLASH*

Your itty-bitty battered body crashes into the foul brew churning below, where its depths instantly engulf your person as it falls in. Mercifully, it muffles all the sounds that tormented your overly-aware senses into oblivion, and despite the beer having been drank well over fifteen minutes ago, it kept the crud liquid cooler than the warm chamber it swirled in. Not-so-mercifully, it tastes sour of rancid snacks and stale liquor verging on ethanol fuel and your whole body tingles to the core on contact; not to mention, it gets everywhere on and in you through any opening it can find – your nostrils, your mouth, your ears, everywhere (yes, especially down there…!). You don’t need to spend another second stewing in this abrasive substance to know that you need to get out of it, fast!

While your swimming has definitively seen better days (those how-many minutes doing laps in Tina’s Pig-Pen-style lager counting), you still manage to muster some strength that you thought lost in your arms and break through the frothy surface of these deadly waters, where whatever is left of your senses is met with violent storm by Cora’s sinkhole of a stomach – your eyes, tearing up from many pains, even though adjusted slightly for darkness during your time in Cora’s mouth, find only the faint glimmer of the slimy walls lost in all the darkness, squirming erratically like twisted wraiths as the organ churns its contents into mushy slurry; your nose, even when overwhelmed and burnt from many spirited fumes, could still pick the strong scent of the temperate, putrid haze that derived from the recently digested snacks. Much like your very body, everything that you can reach for floating in this swirling pool is soaked to the core in Cora’s gastric slime; with some chunks that you manage to hit while flailing to surface breaking apart on your touch and dissolve into more mush, having enduring this process for much longer than you and reaching their breaking point with your contact, they sink below the currents and leave behind a loud sizzling and some gas bubbles as the tracks of a path that you’re soon to follow.

But most agonizing of all was the noise. All that noise, noise, noise!

*CRACKLE*

*GURGLE*

*FIZZ*

*GURGLE*

*POP*

*GURGLE*

And you thought Beth was loud, Cora’s innards are the chaotic definition of cacophony!

After suffering through the tortuously noisy slide down Cora’s gullet and getting that sweet, if brief, escape from its uproar; you hoped that the acid bag sitting at the bottom would at least give you either a quick, or at least silent end to your chain of ordeals, but it seems that was asking too much from your fate as Cora’s speck of a snack. You scream once more, begging for either an end to the commotion or for your timely death; but your pleas are met with a mouthful of juicy, gooey pulp flavored thickly of bile, digested meat and, worse still, cheap cognac, the worst kind of cognac. Needless to say, you return the favor, plus interest – emptying your own nauseated insides into the bubbling, chunky broth.

Subject to the myriad of aches, both caustic and acoustic in nature, you pay no piece of your overwhelmed mind to the warming pool you’re in slewing forwards to the next stop in Cora’s guts: her bowels. Whatever food she ate during and before the party you were swimming in it right now; and your late arrival to the party in her guts means you get to end your life where she complains her boss and landlord are allegedly most painful, and where many a palm-cheeked flirt has sought to end the night: in her ass (well, close enough anyway). Most of the sloshing slurry has already been emptied from her stomach long before your arrival; all that remains is the tiny amount you happened upon.

Still trying in vain to shield your poor ears from the bombard of sound, never mind the rest of your body from melting into pâté on-the-sauce, your body fails to resist the current draining into the sphincter below. You barely spend half a minute in that hellish place before the batter and you are pulled into the next circle: an endless, twisting, even more rotten maze. With little warning, you fall from the sloppy mix and into the squishy floor of muscle below. Immediately you get soaked with another layer of slime, this one much warmer and lighter than the one before; and you stop hearing the slush draining in time to find yourself in a long, seemingly empty space.

Thankfully noise is almost null in this tube, compared to the earlier parts of your endoscopic touring of a volatile cougar; her intestines are the second quietest of the lot. There’s mostly the echo of distant gurgling and small tremors to fill the void of sound, along with a much louder, although more manageable to your ears, squelching sound. Now your nose regrets it instead. The awful, horrid smell becomes the bane of your nostrils once its sheer, overwhelming presence works its way into them, seemingly reviving your sense of smell just to revel in its putrid glory. There’s no other way to describe it, no other word exists that fits its repulsive nature to a bolded capital T.

It’s shit.

With lightning reflexes your palm leaves your ear and your fingers become plugs for your nose, almost as ineffective as they were blocking noise due to their own caking of digestive slime, but they do help to burn out your tortured smell by spreading Cora’s digestion further into your nostril; between some burning pain and enduring the bar janitor's worst nightmare, you were far too eager to plunge into the former.

Wandering lost further into the fleshy tube; you find it hard to believe that you would ever exit your mom’s friend alive – each step you take on the soft muscle rings up the searing aches in your whole body, begging to be put out of its misery. The echoing void lulls your fainting head further into its last slumber; knowing well that you can’t take anymore, it invites you to take permanent residence in this woman’s hips.

Unable to continue any further, you fall into one crevice of the rippled organ as it shudders, landing into a small pool of slime that blankets you in your last sleep. But just before you succumb to your fate, a thunderous blast echoes all around the cavern; carrying a foul wind outside and stealing the precious silence from your dying ears.

DAMNIT!

***

The call of nature yelled its cry with urgency, and Cora wasn’t one to leave it unanswered.

Barely waiting for Sally to open the door, she bolted right in past her, dropping her bags in the hallway and darting straight into the nearest bathroom. One unfastened button and a pair of dropped pants later, her shapely rear was resting gloriously on the plastic seating of the porcelain throne; like a victorious queen returning from the righteous conquest of the unworthy. Or more accurately, a barbarian warlady returning from celebrating a raid with a ravenous feast at the nearest wings-n’-beer.

Relaxing her lower abdomen, she her body expel the stinging pressure along with the waste of her afternoon meal. She sighed in relief, stretching her arm above the cistern to open a small window, then returning to her relaxed position to conclude her business. Wouldn’t want to leave a stink, after all.

To her dismay once she finished, she reached over the cistern lid for a roll of paper, only to find a thin carton tube instead. She glanced over every surface in the room and, much to her horror, found no traces of cushioned double-sheet to clean her messy butt. But she had not to fall in despair, for there was a viable substitute hanging from a laundry hamper just before her – a single undershirt, hanging out from the rim of the plastic canister, like glorious paper waiting to be dispensed from a roll.

She didn’t need to think it twice; she rose from the toilet seat and yanked the cloth from the hamper, flushing her waste away before rubbing the to-be-dirtier cloth thoroughly between her cheeks. It tickled slightly, but it got the job done; and soon the rust-stained shirt was balled up and returned to the hamper, and Cora was washing her hands off the crime. Hopefully Adam won’t mind the free dye… or Sally the smell.

Returning to the living room, she found Sally eating some chips alone on the couch, watching a movie.

“Can’t believe they left on the TV, do they think that I don’t mind the bills?” She complained about her friends’ absence while Cora sat down beside her, taking the same glass she drank from before leaving, then eyeing towards Sally.

“There was some dirt in that.” She said dryly.

“How did you know?” her friend gasped, then asked bewildered.

“Sal, I’ve pissed off enough clerks to know exactly how many loogies I get with my drink by now. You girls weren’t fooling anyone with your suds and tray bunnies.”

Her ploy discovered, Sally sheepishly feigned innocence with a guilty whistle, while Cora stole her glass for herself and some chips from the bowl.

“But thanks for the lift, Sal; all is forgiven then.” Cora reassured her friend. Of course she really appreciated her friend’s solidarity, and couldn’t stay mad at her after her help. Then again, she had just cleaned her steamer on one of her son’s shirts, though she didn’t have to know about that.

“Besides, I was talking about your chips.”
1442112111221.title: Not silent, but definitively deadly

choices: You are uninjured, but get stuck in the food caked into the upper tooth.
1442112112.content:
You try to make a b-line for the front of Cora's mouth but you find traversing her giant tongue to be easier said than done. The unpredictable movements of the muscle combined with the bumpy, squishy surface made you perpetually off balance. Even worse, every other step planted landed you either in a puddle of gooey spit or some kind of smelly white crud that was coating the back of her tongue. This was awful. When Cora let out a brief chuckle, launching you back to near where you started, you were sick taking the tongue route. Your eyes were draw to a suitable alternate, the teeth. It was a perfect plan, the teeth are ridged and form a path straight to the lips. Plus, you wouldn't have to worry about getting swallowed.Cora's back most molar was close and with the tongue's current position, you could easily jump to it. After a short up-tongue struggle, you were in place. You wiped off the excess saliva that your body had accumulated and leapt, aiming for the layer of chewed food packed into the crown. You landed safely, your feet sinking slightly into the unrecognizable mush. You couldn't comprehend the smell coming from it, must have been here for a while. You pull yourself free and scale up to the top of the yellowed enamel. Cora's teeth were less than straight, but you figured you'd worry about each leap when you got there. Getting to the second tooth was easy enough, though rolling down the hard surface hurt a bit. You rubbed your arm, having cut it on a rough patch. If you could keep this pace then you could be out of here in two minutes. You noticed it suddenly getting darker, must be closing her lips. Unfortunately, your inebriated mind was to slow to put the pieces together. If you hadn't just happened to look up, you won't have noticed that the upper teeth were closing down right on top of you. You didn't have time to get out of the way as the jaw came crashing down. You barely had enough time to go prone before-

*CLACK*
1442112112.title: Follow The Yellow Tooth Road

14421121121.content:
Among the deadliest words ever strung together in the English lexicon, few such a devastating effect in the world, ignore all rhyme and reason for the sake of comedic incompetence, disregard the laws of possibility for a dim chance of success, and have ended in so much ruin and misery for their speaker; than these five words uttered together in a single phrase:

What could possibly go wrong?

And woe be to your chaotically addled mind, for those are the very words that course endless laps in it as you keep them to convince yourself that braving your path along Cora’s Great Barrier of Teeth is the best course for you to take; that you would be out of the dangers of Cora’s still-stale mouth before you ran out of breath, and back to the dangers of a greatly enlarged world instead.

However, with your mind lost in a foggy haze and your steps lumbering and sluggish and struggling to avoid tripping, there was simply no way that you would cross the length of her jaw without accident, whether it be by your part or by natural causes; and in your case, it happened to be both.

While diving to go prone (or more accurately, belly-flopping your way into safety) and avoid being crushed by a solid ceiling of stained marble, your clumsy feet finally came to give way to your doom. Walking on the surface of Cora’s chompers was as hard as it got with its layers of filth and saliva, so it came as no surprise when you slipped on the surface of one of her molars in pratfall-like fashion just as the ceiling came down on you.

For a moment after the sound of her teeth clashing echoed all around the cavern, everything stopped around you. Your eyes went dark, white noise filled your ears, your heart played hopscotch with its beats, your lungs became still… and once time came back to normal, a tremendous, unbearable pain took over your right arm starting from your elbow, replacing any other feel or control you had over your limb.

Astonished and wounded beyond heal, you screamed bloody murder and endless profanity as the pain of losing your arm kicks your mind back into sobriety in the worst way possible, at the worst time possible. Out of instinct, you try to push away the ivory boulder away with your remaining arm, but as your lost limb shows, it’s far too heavy to move.

Then, as you lay there harmed and one-armed, a grinding sound starts building up all over Cora’s mouth. It starts out as a mild creaking as you struggle in vain to release whatever chunky salsa is left of your arm from her upper tooth; but it soon blows into a window-shatteringly loud, continuous screeching as this giant lady grits her teeth down as per her upset mood, as one is wont to do in passive-aggressive frustration. Of course, given your place, her normally idle threats of bone-breaking and other violent solutions, normally reserved to vent her frustration, were about to become your grim reality.

The ground quakes and the filth-caking trembles as Cora grinds her teeth, with her mind focused on the traffic outside and worries of her digs remaining pest-free as her teeth chomps what’s left of your arm into meat paste and bone-meal; severing whatever tendons were left to hold it to your body in the process and finally removing your arm in its entirety, leaving behind only a bloody stump and the unbearable sting of its loss. Worse still, once the upper tooth passing right above your head finds its way into the crevice you’re hidden in, it’s too late for you.

You barely feel it at first over the loss of your arm, the crushing pressure of her caramel-enamel molar filling the space you’ve crawled into with chirring intensity, a screech that would have surely pieced your mind back together from the bottom of the keg, hadn’t your recent impromptu amputation accomplished that a moment ago; just in time for it to squash your legs in the same way, and work its way up the rest of your body from there.

All you can do while Cora’s ivory boulders pummel, crack and snap your bones is scream. Scream curses in pain, yell out for help, cry out for mercy, pleading it all to stop. Only when your consciousness abandons you does the pain finally end; your last remaining limb, still tensed while holding its lost twin’s mangled stump, finally releases its hold at the same time that your cries begin to fade. At last, your plight is over, and your mother’s friend is free to worry about her presumed-infested home without ever thinking about the grizzly scene unfolding at the back of her mouth due to the venting of her distress.

In short order her molars knead your mutilated corpse into a thick red paste while she grinds her teeth, each run further reducing and spreading your remains over the crevice. Then, a while later, a wave of beer washes over your remains and drags them over into her throat, where the last remaining tracks of your existence are sent to join her lunch.

***

“Back to your merry melodies, I see.” Sally noted as she heard her friend whistling a lively tune while taking out a six-minus-one-pack from the fridge.

“Hey, it’s not like I’m going to leave these to the rats.” Cora responded, placing the bundle of red labels on the counter that Sally was resting against, sitting on a stool just opposite to her.

“It’s not like they’re going to raid your fridge, I’m sure even them have some standards.” The party host continued, spinning her key-ring around her index as her friend gave her a quick sarcastic glance, then returned to her can.

“Like hell they will. But you’ve heard Mike, either those little fuckers will kill the power, or the guys running the bill will. Better get these while they’re still cold.” Cora said, ending with the clack of the can opening and the slurping of the frothy brew as she drank leisurely.

“So what, food spoils as well; are you going to bring back the whole fridge too? Come on.” Sally joked, toying with the key-ring no longer and resting her arms crossed on the counter, watching Cora down half of her can while tapping the bottom with her pinky.

“Only what’s important, Sally. Only what truly matters.” She broke her drinking for a moment to respond in a dignified classy tone.

“Ah… Good thing shopping was due tomorrow, or I’d be really pissed.” In a few more gulps, the can in Cora’s hand was empty, and her voice was back in its usual casual manner.

“Heavens have mercy then.” Sally joked around again, lining her lips with a smirk. Cora, letting out a stiff laugh herself, grabbed another can from the pack and slid it across the counter so it stood between her and Sally.

“Hey, want this one? It’s the coldest.” She offered, placing the can closer to Sally and grinning herself at her own faux-generosity, knowing well that she wouldn’t accept.

“One of us has to drive us back, Cora.” Sally responded, pushing the can back while giving her friend a sarcastic smile of her own.

“Hah, I know, just being polite.” A sly wink and another clacking sound followed Cora’s own joke, and afterwards another sip after sip of beer filled the ambient between the two women and their chat.

“Good grief, you’re already drunk then.” Sally replied once more, the smirk never leaving her grin. Cora paused her drinking for a moment to snicker herself and respond, standing up from her stool and walking around the counter, past Sally’s back, and picking up a small wrapped-up box from her couch.

“Pfft… Bite me. Now, let’s get this back to the car, I don’t want to miss the girls pissing their pants when the giant spider part comes up.”

“I told you, we just reacted!” Sally yelled defensively, turning around halfway in her seat to face Cora, while keeping one arm on the counter. “I mean, they reacted! I was just playing along!”

Cora just kept snickering at her friend’s attempts to save face, and with a smug smile of her own and a finger lifted from her can, she pointed out to Sally’s arm on the counter and said sternly:

“There’s a cricket right next to your hand now, Miss Empathy.”

“Yeah, right, re- EEK!” Sally knew deep down that she should know better than to fall for such a setup, especially as far as her hawkish friend was concerned, but at the moment that she was about to shoot her joke off, a sudden itch appeared along her hand from the tip of her pinky and all the way to her palm. A shrill shriek worthy of a ghastly banshee escaped from the bottom of her lungs for all the building to hear, and she immediately jumped off from her seat on the bar to see that the empty can from Cora’s earlier drink had tipped over at just the worst moment for her, leaving her in embarrassment to her friend’s exploded laughter.

“Bwahahaha! Oh… oh damn… that was just priceless…” Though her day so far had its fair share of ups-and-downs, this certainly had to be the highlight of the day for the temporarily displaced tenant. She could barely speak out between bouts of her crack-up, less so when her laugh was taking all the air from her lungs; yet when her friend’s expression changed from all-knowing smugness to mild scorn, she knew that they had killed enough time, and should get back to her house before the other girls thought they went bowling without them or something of the like. Still, as much as she tried to stiff it, she couldn’t help a quiet giggle or two from escaping her lips, something that didn’t go unnoticed by Sally as they grabbed Cora’s luggage plus the remaining cans and went back to the car.

“Oh, bite me!”
14421121121.title: Followed by your legs... and back... and head...
